snippet: The tax deal reached by Congress would begin phasing out personal exemptions and many deductions for people with adjusted gross incomes over $250,000 for singles and $300,000 for couples. The impact on a hypothetical couple earning $400,000 a year,...
lead_paragraph: The tax deal reached by Congress would begin phasing out personal exemptions and many deductions for people with adjusted gross incomes over $250,000 for singles and $300,000 for couples. The impact on a hypothetical couple earning $400,000 a year, with two children, would vary by state. In states with high taxes, like New York, residents are often more vulnerable to the alternative minimum tax, which can cost them more than the new limits might. In Texas, which has no income tax, a couple may see a bigger federal tax increase.

headline.main: How the New Limits on Deductions and Exemptions Might Work
